segments.content: Recently, the React core team overhauled the way errors are handled in React 19. Those improvements are available in React 19 canary releases and should probably land in Next.js 14.2+ sooner or later. This notably includes new public API callbacks available on the React Root (`createRoot`, `hydrateRoot`):

Those improvements are available in React 19 canary releases and should probably land in Next.js 14.2+ sooner or later. This notably includes new public API callbacks available on the React Root (`createRoot`, `hydrateRoot`):
segments.translated_content: 近期React核心团队彻底改进了React 19的错误处理机制。这些改进已存在于React 19金丝雀版本中，预计将随Next.js 14.2+版本发布。主要包括React根节点（`createRoot`、`hydrateRoot`）上可用的新公共API回调：

segments.content:
* `onCaughtError` 🆕 reports errors caught by error boundaries
* `onUncaughtError` 🆕 reports uncaught errors (duh)
* `onRecoverableError` now uses the ES Error Cause feature to report the original cause
segments.sourceMdx:
- `onCaughtError` 🆕 reports errors caught by error boundaries
- `onUncaughtError` 🆕 reports uncaught errors (duh)
- `onRecoverableError` now uses the ES Error Cause feature to report the original cause
segments.translated_content:
- `onCaughtError` 🆕 报告被错误边界捕获的错误
- `onUncaughtError` 🆕 报告未捕获错误（显而易见）
- `onRecoverableError` 现使用ES Error Cause特性报告原始错误原因

segments.content: The linked PR is the WIP documentation for those new APIs, including many interactive examples. The main motivation seems to be presenting an error dialog to the user.

segments.content: What excited me most in all this is that it's the first time I'm able to see in action the brand-new React hydration error message displayed in a dialog, as shown in the screenshot above. This will greatly improve the DX of React!

segments.content:
* 💸 [Get drop-in authentication for your React app using Clerk, with ready-to-use components, hooks, and helpers.](https://go.clerk.com/WtsedFE)
* 👀 [React Core - Fast JSX: Don't clone props object](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28768): Creating JSX elements under React 19 should become much faster. Recent changes in how key/refs are handled make it possible to avoid cloning props. We create a lot of JSX nodes so this should have a significant impact!
* 👀 [React Core - Remove defaultProps support (except for classes)](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28733)
* 👀 [React Core - Rename SECRET INTERNALS](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28789)
* 🐦 [TIL React can render promises and contexts as JSX nodes](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1777383298618077331)
* 📖 [TanStack Query - new Render Optimizations guide](https://tanstack.com/query/v5/docs/framework/react/guides/render-optimizations): It’s nice that React Query uses structural sharing under the hood, and try hard to preserve object identities over time.
* 📈 [Docusaurus has overtaken Gatsby’s npm downloads](https://npmtrends.com/@docusaurus/core-vs-@remix-run/react-vs-astro-vs-gatsby-vs-nextra-vs-vitepress-vs-vuepress): It feels surreal that the framework I work on is now the 2nd most used React web framework just after Next.js (far behind), despite its focus on content-centric websites. This should not last though: Astro, Remix, and Expo Web have more potential to grow.
* 🗓 [React Summit](https://reactsummit.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - 🇳🇱 Amsterdam - 14-18 June - Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR".
* 🗓 [React Connection - 22 April](https://reactconnection.io/) + [React-Native Connection - 23 April](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) - 🇫🇷 Paris - 2 days of web/mobile conferences. Get a [-20% discount](https://www.billetweb.fr/react-connection-2024?discount=TWIR) with code "TWIR".
* 📜 [New Flow Language Features for React](https://medium.com/flow-type/announcing-component-syntax-b6c5285660d0): Meta engineers use Flow (and not TypeScript). This post presents the benefits of new keywords `component`, `hook`, and `renders` keywords introduced directly into the language, and presents great benefits in terms of DX, type-safety, and static analysis in general. I wish we had those in TypeScript too, but since it’s specific to React it’s unlikely to happen unless benefiting the whole JS ecosystem.
* 📜 [Are Inline Styles Faster than CSS?](https://danielnagy.me/posts/Post_tsr8q6sx37pl): Daniel implemented his personal React website in 3 variants and measured several things: HTML/JS size, compression, Web Vitals… Surprisingly, using plain inline styles outperforms other CSS techniques!
* 📜 [Exploring using Suspense with React Query](https://www.teemutaskula.com/blog/exploring-query-suspense): Nicely explains how you can improve the UX when using React Query. Creates a `useSuspenseQueryDeferred` to avoid showing a Suspense fallback on query key changes.
* 📜 [React Server Components in a Nutshell](https://thenewstack.io/react-server-components-in-a-nutshell/): Paul takes Waku to illustrate how RSCs enable convenient server-side requests at the component level, while former solutions only supported route level. He also makes an interesting comparison between Gatsby’s static queries and RSCs.
* 📜 [Jotai Tips](https://blog.axlight.com/posts/jotai-tips/): Daishi aggregated 20 Jotai tips in a single article.
* 📜 [State machines in React](https://thesametech.com/state-machines-in-react/): Implements a wizard flow by building a state machine from scratch.
* 📜 [Server-only Code in Next.js App Router](https://www.builder.io/blog/server-only-next-app-router): Use server-only and client-only packages to ensure code runs where it should.
* 📜 [Next.js Forms with Server Actions](https://www.jtmthf.com/posts/nextjs-forms): A tutorial using Radix Form (in preview) to implement form elements compatible with Server Actions.
* 📜 [Exploring Server Actions with Next.js](https://www.robinwieruch.de/next-server-actions/): A Tutorial showing how to do each CRUD operation.
* 📜 [Techniques for Fetching Data - Comparing Next.js, Remix, and RedwoodJS](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/techniques-for-fetching-data): Revisits old data fetching techniques to explain why RSC is better.
* 📜 [React 19 - Part 1: The Backstory; My journey writing a framework from scratch!](https://www.cmrg.me/blog/rsc-part-1-the-backstory)
* 📜 [Synchronize Backend and Frontend Types With tRPC](https://marmelab.com/blog/2024/04/04/trpc-full-stack-types.html)
* 📦 [Jotai Effect 1.0 - A Jōtai utility package for reactive side-effects](https://github.com/jotaijs/jotai-effect/releases/tag/v1.0.0)
* 📦 [Jotai 2.8 - atomWithLazy, experimental store](https://github.com/pmndrs/jotai/releases/tag/v2.8.0)
* 📦 [react-testing-library 15.0 - requires Node 18, supports new WAI-ARIA 1.2 roles](https://github.com/testing-library/react-testing-library/releases/tag/v15.0.0)
* 📦 [use-signals - An experimental React hook for TC39 signals](https://github.com/dai-shi/use-signals)
* 🎥 [Jack Herrington - Declarative Routes for NextJS and React-Router](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MiZcNHJT_Ss): Jack introduced [declarative-routing](https://github.com/ProNextJS/declarative-routing), a new typesafe routing solution he’s working on with support for React Router and Next.js. It also supports API routes, which makes it an alternative to tRPC with control over the API endpoints.
* 🎥 [Theo - Facebook wrote a language just for React](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HOFIefkepMA)
* 🎥 [James Quick - Don’t Make This Mistake with Next.js Server Components](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F_AplRX3dJU)

- 💸 [使用Clerk为你的React应用添加即插即用认证功能，提供开箱即用的组件、钩子和辅助工具。](https://go.clerk.com/WtsedFE)
- 👀 [React核心 - 快速JSX：不再克隆props对象](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28768)：在React 19下创建JSX元素将大幅提速。近期对key/ref处理方式的变更使得避免props克隆成为可能。由于我们创建大量JSX节点，这应该会产生显著性能提升！
- 👀 [React核心 - 移除defaultProps支持（类组件除外）](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28733)
- 👀 [React核心 - 重命名SECRET INTERNALS](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28789)
- 🐦 [今日发现：React可以将Promise和Context作为JSX节点渲染](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1777383298618077331)
- 📖 [TanStack Query - 全新渲染优化指南](https://tanstack.com/query/v5/docs/framework/react/guides/render-optimizations)：React Query底层采用结构共享机制，并努力保持对象引用的稳定性，这点非常棒。
- 📈 [Docusaurus的npm下载量已超越Gatsby](https://npmtrends.com/@docusaurus/core-vs-@remix-run/react-vs-astro-vs-gatsby-vs-nextra-vs-vitepress-vs-vuepress)：令人难以置信的是，这个我参与开发的框架现已成为仅次于Next.js（差距较大）的第二大React Web框架，尽管它主要面向内容型网站。不过这种局面可能不会持久：Astro、Remix和Expo Web更具增长潜力。
- 🗓 [React峰会](https://reactsummit.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - 🇳🇱 阿姆斯特丹 - 6月14-18日 - 使用优惠码"TWIR"可享9折。
- 🗓 [React Connection - 4月22日](https://reactconnection.io/) + [React-Native Connection - 4月23日](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) - 🇫🇷 巴黎 - 为期两天的Web/移动端技术大会。使用优惠码"TWIR"可享[8折优惠](https://www.billetweb.fr/react-connection-2024?discount=TWIR)。
- 📜 [Flow为React推出的新语言特性](https://medium.com/flow-type/announcing-component-syntax-b6c5285660d0)：Meta工程师使用Flow（而非TypeScript）。本文介绍了直接引入语言的新关键字`component`、`hook`和`renders`的优势，这些特性在开发者体验、类型安全和静态分析方面带来显著提升。虽然希望TypeScript也能支持，但由于这些特性专为React设计，除非能惠及整个JS生态，否则可能性不大。
- 📜 [内联样式真的比CSS快吗？](https://danielnagy.me/posts/Post_tsr8q6sx37pl)：Daniel用三种方式实现个人网站并测量各项指标：HTML/JS体积、压缩率、Web性能指标...令人惊讶的是，纯内联样式竟优于其他CSS方案！
- 📜 [探索React Query与Suspense的结合使用](https://www.teemutaskula.com/blog/exploring-query-suspense)：精彩阐述了如何在使用React Query时提升用户体验。通过创建`useSuspenseQueryDeferred`避免在查询键变更时显示Suspense回退界面。
- 📜 [React服务端组件精要](https://thenewstack.io/react-server-components-in-a-nutshell/)：Paul以Waku为例说明RSC如何实现组件级的服务端请求，而传统方案仅支持路由级。他还对Gatsby的静态查询与RSC做了有趣对比。
- 📜 [Jotai使用技巧](https://blog.axlight.com/posts/jotai-tips/)：Daishi将20个Jotai技巧汇总成文。
- 📜 [React中的状态机](https://thesametech.com/state-machines-in-react/)：从零构建状态机实现向导流程。
- 📜 [Next.js App Router中的服务端专属代码](https://www.builder.io/blog/server-only-next-app-router)：使用server-only和client-only包确保代码在正确环境执行。
- 📜 [Next.js表单与Server Actions](https://www.jtmthf.com/posts/nextjs-forms)：使用Radix Form（预览版）实现兼容Server Actions的表单元素教程。

- 📜 [数据获取技术对比 - Next.js、Remix与RedwoodJS](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/techniques-for-fetching-data)：通过回顾传统数据获取方案阐释RSC的优势。
- 📜 [React 19 - 第一部：幕后故事；我从零编写框架的历程！](https://www.cmrg.me/blog/rsc-part-1-the-backstory)
- 📜 [使用tRPC同步前后端类型](https://marmelab.com/blog/2024/04/04/trpc-full-stack-types.html)
- 📦 [Jotai Effect 1.0 - 用于响应式副作用处理的Jōtai工具包](https://github.com/jotaijs/jotai-effect/releases/tag/v1.0.0)

segments.content: One of the most inspiring things in the RN community is observing folks like Marc Rousavy, William Candillon and Christian Falch pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with this technology and going far beyond rendering text and buttons on a screen. With the recent Skia announcements, we saw the state of the art regarding 2D rendering in RN. Now, Marc provided a sneak peek of some exciting advancements in 3D rendering with RN. Apparently, Margelo is working on a new library to enable access to the native Graphics APIs (Metal/Vulkan) from RN. Apart from the short [demo video](https://twitter.com/JPoliachik/status/1775866218743787934), I also found this [thread](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1775870100945461277) very interesting, where Marc explains their approach using a C++ library and why they didn’t go with Three.js, which is amazing on web (React-Three-Fiber supports RN).
segments.sourceMdx: One of the most inspiring things in the RN community is observing folks like Marc Rousavy, William Candillon and Christian Falch pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with this technology and going far beyond rendering text and buttons on a screen. With the recent Skia announcements, we saw the state of the art regarding 2D rendering in RN. Now, Marc provided a sneak peek of some exciting advancements in 3D rendering with RN. Apparently, Margelo is working on a new library to enable access to the native Graphics APIs (Metal/Vulkan) from RN. Apart from the short [demo video](https://twitter.com/JPoliachik/status/1775866218743787934), I also found this [thread](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1775870100945461277) very interesting, where Marc explains their approach using a C++ library and why they didn’t go with Three.js, which is amazing on web (React-Three-Fiber supports RN).
segments.translated_content: RN社区最令人振奋的景象，莫过于见证Marc Rousavy、William Candillon和Christian Falch等技术先驱不断突破框架边界，实现远超文本按钮的基础渲染能力。随着Skia相关技术的发布，我们已见识到RN在2D渲染领域的顶尖水平。如今Marc又透露了RN在3D渲染方面的重大进展——Margelo团队正在开发可通过RN直接调用原生图形API（Metal/Vulkan）的新库。除了这段[演示视频](https://twitter.com/JPoliachik/status/1775866218743787934)，Marc在[技术解析推文](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1775870100945461277)中阐述的C++库实现路径及放弃Three.js（尽管React-Three-Fiber在Web端表现出色）的决策也极具启发性。
